meanings.sent1: She was hippin around the playground with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah was hippin through the savanna to catch its prey.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hippin so fast, it looked like it had springs in its feet!
meanings.sent4: The wind was hippin through the trees, making them sway back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's feet were hippin across the stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A person who is very fashionable or up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: She always dresses like a hippin, with the latest trends and styles.
meanings.sent2: The model on the magazine cover looked like a true hippin.
meanings.sent3: Everyone at the party admired her outfit and called her a real hippin.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like a shining star, a true hippin among the rest.
meanings.sent5: Her sense of fashion was so unique and trendy, she was the ultimate hippin.

meanings.definition: A style of music or fashion associated with the 1960s counterculture.
meanings.sent1: The hippin music of the 60s had a unique and groovy vibe.
meanings.sent2: She loved to dress in hippin clothes inspired by the 1960s.
meanings.sent3: The retro party was filled with people dressed in hippin attire.
meanings.sent4: The hippin fashion of the past made a comeback on the runway.
meanings.sent5: The hippin culture of the 60s was all about peace, love, and freedom.
